com.polarion.platform.service.repository

Interface IRepositoryService


  • public interface IRepositoryService
    Storage which stores arbitrary files in hierarchical (folders-files) structure.

    Transactional support is mandatory. However implementation which can't support it may choose to implement lowest isolation level where concurrent transactions influence each other.

    File changes reporting through IFileChangesListener is mandatory. Events must be fired on transaction commit.

    Author:
    Stepan Roh, Polarion Software, Stanislav Spiridonov

      • getRepository

        IRepositoryInfo getRepository(java.lang.String repositoryName)
                       throws RepositoryException
        Returns the repository by repository name (the name of repository must be unique)

        The name can't be a null

        Parameters:
        repositoryName -
        Returns:
        repository information or null
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • getRepository

        IRepositoryInfo getRepository(ILocation loc)
                       throws RepositoryException
        Convenience method, which determines the repository name from the given location. If the location contains no repository name or if the location is null, then the DEFAULT is used as repository name.

        Otherwise this method behaves the same as getRepository(String).

        Parameters:
        loc -
        Returns:
        repository information or null
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

        Collection of IRepositoryInfo
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • getConnection

        IRepositoryConnection getConnection(java.lang.String repositoryName)
                             throws RepositoryException
        Return the connection to specific repository

        The name can't be a null

        Can be used only inside transaction. The returned connection object is not valid after the end of current transaction.

        Parameters:
        repositoryName - - name of registered repository
        Returns:
        a Connection to requested repository
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

        IRepositoryConnection getConnection(ILocation location)
                             throws RepositoryException
        Convenience method, which determines the repository name from the given location. If the location contains no repository name or if the location is null, then the DEFAULT is used as repository name.

        Otherwise this method behaves the same as getConnection(String).

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a Connection to requested location
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • getReadOnlyConnection

        IRepositoryReadOnlyConnection getReadOnlyConnection(java.lang.String repositoryName)
                                             throws RepositoryException
        Return the read only connection to specific repository

        The name can't be a null

        Can be used outside transaction. However, if called inside transaction, the resulting connection object is not valid after the transaction is completed. Therefore clients should not perform long-term caching of the connection objects.

        Parameters:
        repositoryName - - name of registered repository
        Returns:
        a Connection to requested repository
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • getReadOnlyConnection

        IRepositoryReadOnlyConnection getReadOnlyConnection(ILocation location)

        Convenience method, which determines the repository name from the given location. If the location contains no repository name or if the location is null, then the DEFAULT is used as repository name.

        Otherwise this method behaves the same as getReadOnlyConnection(String).

        Parameters:
        location -
        Returns:
        a Connection to requested location
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

        Register file changes listener on all changes.

        The listener can't be a null

        Parameters:
        listener - listener

      • addFileChangesListener

        void addFileChangesListener(IFileChangesListener l,
                            java.util.Collection locations)
        Register file changes listener on changes of given locations and their sublocations.

        No checking of validity or existence of given locations is performed. The incorrect locations will be ignored

        The listener can't be a null

        Parameters:
        l - listener
        locations - Collection of ILocations

      • removeFileChangesListener

        void removeFileChangesListener(IFileChangesListener l)
        Unregister file changes listener.

        The listener can't be a null

        Parameters:
        l - listener

      • stuffFileChangesListener

        void stuffFileChangesListener(IFileChangesListener l,
                              java.util.Collection locations,
                              java.lang.String repositoryState)
                       throws RepositoryException
        Will feed listener all changes since given repository state (inclusive) in given locations (if specified).

        If such listener is already registered it will get both normal and stuffed events and it may get them asynchronously.

        Some changes may occur multiple times (even double creations of same resource). Callers must be aware of this and be able to deal with it.

        It is ensured that notifications are sent in proper order (from oldest to newest changes).

        Blocks until all objects were stuffed into the listener.

        The listener and repository state can't be a null

        Parameters:
        l - listener
        locations - Collection of ILocations (null is the same as empty collection)
        repositoryState - state to start from
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if error occurs

        Returns:

      • getLocationForAccessibleURL

        ILocation getLocationForAccessibleURL(java.net.URI url)
                               throws RepositoryException
        Returns location for universally accessible URL.

        The URL can't be a null and must belong to connected repository

        Parameters:
        url -
        Returns:
        location (not null)
        Throws:
        RepositoryException
        See Also:
        IResourceProperties.getAccessibleURI()

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the registered class name for given schema or null if there are no drivers registered for such schema
